item.title: Fisher Information
item.description: Given a probability density model $f(X; \theta)$ for a observable $X$, the amount of information that $X$ carriers regarding the model is called Fisher information. Given ${\theta}$, the probability of observing the value $X$, i.e., the likelihood is $$ f(X\mid\theta). $$ To describe the suitability of a model and the observables, we can use a the likelihood $f(X\mid \theta)$. One particular interesting property is the sensitivity of the likelihood in terms of the parameter $\theta$ change.
